carousel_items: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Keppra is an antiepileptic medication. It prevents seizures by helping regulate neurotransmitters in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Keppra is effective for preventing seizures in people with epilepsy. Compared to other anti-seizure medications, it has few drug interactions and you don’t need to get your levels checked.
downsides: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

downsides_processed.orig: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

userStories.tip: I personally couldn't tolerate alcohol at all while on medication as it amplifies the side effect of drowsiness considerably.

My daughter has been taking Keppra since her seizures began over two years ago.  She began with 500mg and has slowly increased due to continued seizures to now 2500mg daily. No side effects with mostly success at this level for over a year.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I was on Keppra for 11 years, stopped 1 year ago. It caused depression. I stayed on it to focus on my career and got off at semi-retirement. Getting off it took one year; lowering the dose (very slowly) to below 1/2 caused awful seizures.

drugs.name: Keppra

carousel_items_processed.orig: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatnening skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Taking Keppra can make you feel sleepy, dizzy, and affect your coordination. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how Keppra affects you.
risk_factors: Starting the first month of therapy
Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Taking Keppra can make you feel sleepy, dizzy, and affect your coordination. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how Keppra affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Keppra suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Keppra, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Keppra suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Keppra, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric side effects
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may change your mood and behavior. Watch out for any changes, such as increased aggression or hostility, depression, anxiety, or rapid shifts in your mood (emotional lability). Let your doctor know if you experience these changes.

description_processed.orig: Keppra may change your mood and behavior. Watch out for any changes, such as increased aggression or hostility, depression, anxiety, or rapid shifts in your mood (emotional lability). Let your doctor know if you experience these changes.

carousel_items: You can experience dizziness, drowsiness, double vision, stomach upset, and trouble with coordination while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or thoughts of suicide, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Oxcarbazepine, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
Oxcarbazepine makes birth control and many other medicines less effective.
Oxcarbazepine can be taken with or without food.
If you're taking the oral suspension, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.

basics.benefits_moa: Oxcarbazepine is an antiepileptic medication. It reduces seizures by blocking certain types of nerve activity that regulate how your brain cells communicate with each other.
basics.bottom_line: Oxcarbazepine is effective at preventing seizures and you don’t need to get regular blood tests to make sure it’s effective, but it has many drug interactions.
downsides: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Oxcarbazepine has steady levels in your body.
Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Can cause difficulty concentrating, tiredness or drowsiness, and problems with coordination.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Being pregnant lowers the levels of Oxcarbazepine, so the medicine might not be as effective at preventing seizures.

downsides_processed.orig: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Oxcarbazepine has steady levels in your body.
Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Can cause difficulty concentrating, tiredness or drowsiness, and problems with coordination.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Being pregnant lowers the levels of Oxcarbazepine, so the medicine might not be as effective at preventing seizures.

upsides: Oxcarbazepine is effective at lowering the frequency of seizures, especially for people with partial seizures.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Oxcarbazepine is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

upsides_processed.orig: Oxcarbazepine is effective at lowering the frequency of seizures, especially for people with partial seizures.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Oxcarbazepine is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

drugs.name: Trileptal

carousel_items_processed.orig: You can experience dizziness, drowsiness, double vision, stomach upset, and trouble with coordination while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or thoughts of suicide, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Oxcarbazepine, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
Oxcarbazepine makes birth control and many other medicines less effective.
Oxcarbazepine can be taken with or without food.
If you're taking the oral suspension, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to low sodium
risks_warnings.description: Oxcarbazepine may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

description_processed.orig: Oxcarbazepine may increase the risk of low sodium levels in the blood (hyponatremia). Watch out for symptoms including headache, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, confusion, weakness, and unsteadiness, which may lead to falls. Talk to a doctor right away before developing more serious symptoms, such as hallucination, fainting, coma, and death.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Oxcarbazepine can cause serious allergic reactions, involving angioedema (swelling of the skin) and life-threatening organ failure. However, this is very rare.  If your lips or eyelids suddenly start to swell or you find it hard to breathe, seek medical attention immediately. 25 to 30% of people who had an allergic reaction to Tegretol, another antiepileptic medication, have also had an allergic reaction to Oxcarbazepine, so let your doctor know if you've taken Tegretol before.

description_processed.orig: Oxcarbazepine can cause serious allergic reactions, involving angioedema (swelling of the skin) and life-threatening organ failure. However, this is very rare.  If your lips or eyelids suddenly start to swell or you find it hard to breathe, seek medical attention immediately. 25 to 30% of people who had an allergic reaction to Tegretol, another antiepileptic medication, have also had an allergic reaction to Oxcarbazepine, so let your doctor know if you've taken Tegretol before.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatnening skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Oxcarbazepine has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Oxcarbazepine, let your doctor know immediately.

description_processed.orig: Oxcarbazepine has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Oxcarbazepine, let your doctor know immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Oxcarbazepine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Oxcarbazepine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Oxcarbazepine suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Oxcarbazepine, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Oxcarbazepine suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Oxcarbazepine, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood cells
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Oxcarbazepine may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body, especially white blood cells. You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Oxcarbazepine. Let your doctor know if you start getting unusual bruises, fevers, infections, or mouth ulcers.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Oxcarbazepine may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body, especially white blood cells. You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Oxcarbazepine. Let your doctor know if you start getting unusual bruises, fevers, infections, or mouth ulcers.

risks_warnings.title: Bone disorders
risks_warnings.description: Taking Oxcarbazepine for a long time has been associated with reduced bone mineral density, fractures, and osteoporosis. Your doctor may monitor your bone mineral density regularly and start you on calcium or vitamin D supplements.

description_processed.orig: Taking Oxcarbazepine for a long time has been associated with reduced bone mineral density, fractures, and osteoporosis. Your doctor may monitor your bone mineral density regularly and start you on calcium or vitamin D supplements.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Hepatitis and liver failure have been reported with Oxcarbazepine. However, this is very rare. Call your doctor right away if you start to have clay-colored stools, yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, stomach pain, or if you are eating less than usual without trying to.

description_processed.orig: Hepatitis and liver failure have been reported with Oxcarbazepine. However, this is very rare. Call your doctor right away if you start to have clay-colored stools, yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, stomach pain, or if you are eating less than usual without trying to.

risks_warnings.title: Low thyroid levels
risks_warnings.description: Hypothyroidism (low thyroid levels) have been reported with Oxcarbazepine. Your thyroid levels may need to be tested regularly, Let your doctor know if you are more fatigued, gaining weight without any apparent reason, feeling more depressed, or are more sensitive to cold.

description_processed.orig: Hypothyroidism (low thyroid levels) have been reported with Oxcarbazepine. Your thyroid levels may need to be tested regularly, Let your doctor know if you are more fatigued, gaining weight without any apparent reason, feeling more depressed, or are more sensitive to cold.

points.notes: Monotherapy in patients not previously treated with AED. The most commonly observed (≥5%) adverse reactions seen in association with Trileptal in these patients were similar to those in previously treated adult and pediatric patients.
